div.l: ¶ Now may men seye that I ne am but an ape
Yit hath my felawe svmwhat fore his harm
For hee hath thee Melleres dowghtter īn his arm
Hee awntrede hym ⁊and hath his nedis spedde
And I lygge as a draf sac here in my bedde
And whanne this iape is toold annother day
Thanne schall I been hoolde a daffe ⁊and a cokenay
I wille a ryse and avntre mee bee my fayht
Vn hardy is vn sely for this men sayht
¶ And vppe hee a roos and softlye hee wentte
Vnto thee Cradell and in his hondis it hentte
And baar it softlye vnto his beddis feet
Sone after that thee wyif here rowtyngge leet
And gan to wake ⁊and wente here owt to pisse
And come a geyn ⁊and gan here cradell mysse
And gropede heere ⁊and theer but sche fond noon
Allas qduod schee I hadde almost mys goon
I hadde almost goon to thee clerkis bedde
Eey Benedicite thanne hadde I fowle I spedde
And foorht schee gooht till schee the cradell fond
Schee gropyt alwey forthere wᵗith here hond
And foond thee bed ⁊and thowghtte nowt but good
For by cavze that thee Cradell by hit stood
Sche ne wiste where schee was fore it was derk
But feyre and well schee crepte in by the clerk
And lyght full stille ⁊and wolde have cavght a sleepe
Wᵗith inne a while this Iohn thee clerk vp leepe
And on this gode wyif hee leyght on sore
Soo merie a fitte ne hadde sche longe bee foore
He Rydde well hee was a ioly clerk
For often tyme hee made vp thee werk
And evere ylike freche and ylike glade
This ioly lyif haven this two clerkis hade
¶ Till that thee thridde koc by gan forto syngge
Aleyn was wery in thee dawenyngge
For hee hadde swonken all thee longge nyght
¶ And seyde fare weell Malyn swete wyght
Thee day is come I may no lenggere a byde
But evere more where soo I goo or ryde
¶ I am thyin owne clerk so have I sele
Now dere lemman qduod schee goo fare weell
But or thow goo oo thyng I will thee telle
Whanne that thow wendest homward bee the Melle
Ryght atte thee entre of thee dore be hynde
Thow schalt a cake of half a busschell fynde
That was Maked of thyin owne Mele
Thee wyche that I helpe my sire forto stele
And good lēmman god thee save and kepe
And wᵗith that word almost schee gan to wepe
¶ Aleyn vp a rist and thowghttevp a rist and thowghtte ore it dawe
I wille go crepe in by my felawe
Hee fonde the cradell wᵗith his hond annon
By god thowghtte hee all wrong have I gon
Myn heed is toty offe my swynk to nyght
That makyht mee that I goo nowght ryght
I woot be thee cradell I haue mysgo
Here lyght thee Mellere and his wyif also
And foorht hee gooht a twenty devell wey
Vnto thee bed theere as thee Mellere lay
He wende haue cropen īn by his felawe Iohn
And bee thee Mellere hee crepyht in anon
And cawghtte hym bee the the necke and softe he spake
And seyde thow Iohn swynis heed awake
For cristis sowle here thow now a fyin game
For by that lord that called is seynt iame
As I haue thries in this schorte nyght
Swived thee Melleris dowghtter bolte vp ryght
Whilis thow as a coward has been a gast
Ye fals harlot qduod thee Mellere in greet hast
¶ A fals traytᵘur fals clerk quod hee
Thow schalt been deed by goddis dynitee
Whoo durste been soo boold to desꝑparage
My dowghter that is comyn of swiche lynage
And bee thee throte bolle hee cawghtte aleyn
And hee hym hentte despituslye a geyn
¶ And on thee nose hee smot hym wᵗith his fest
Down ran thee blood strem vppon his brest
In thee floore wᵗith nose and mowht I broke
